meanings.definition: To shape into folds or parallel ridges
meanings.sent1: She used a special tool to corrugate the paper for the art project.
meanings.sent2: The factory corrugates cardboard to make it stronger for packaging.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to corrugate the dough to give the pie a unique texture.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to corrugate the sand dunes, creating beautiful patterns.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly to corrugate the clay into a stunning sculpture.

meanings.definition: Having a ridged or wrinkled surface
meanings.sent1: The corrugate metal roof reflected the sunlight brightly.
meanings.sent2: The corrugate cardboard box was sturdy and reliable for shipping.
meanings.sent3: The corrugate surface of the road caused the car to bounce slightly.
meanings.sent4: The corrugate texture of the fabric added a unique touch to the dress.
meanings.sent5: The corrugate appearance of the leaves made them stand out in the forest.
